title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.01
frontText: What is the result of "" instanceof Object?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.02
frontText: What is the result of null instanceof Object?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.03
frontText: What is the result of "" instanceof java.util.HashMap?
backText: Does not compile. The compiler recognizes that a String cannot be a HashMap. (This check is enforced for classes but not interfaces.)

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.04
frontText: What does equals() take as a parameter?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.05
frontText: If obj1.equals(obj2) returns true, what is true of hashCode()?
backText: obj1.hashCode() and obj2.hashCode() must return the same result.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.06
frontText: True or false? An enum may be compared to an int in a switch statement.
backText: False. An enum is only allowed to use the enum value in a case.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.07
frontText: What is polymorphism?
backText: The property in Java for an object to take on many different forms

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.08
frontText: Why is loose coupling preferred to tight coupling when designing classes?
backText: Loosely coupled classes have fewer dependencies on one another, are more resistant to change, and can be used in more places.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.09
frontText: What is the difference between an object and a reference in Java?
backText: An object is a representation of the entity that exists in memory, while a reference provides a way of pointing to the object.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.10
frontText: True or false? A functional interface may include any number of static or default methods?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.11
frontText: True or false? An interface requires the @FunctionalInterface annotation to be interpreted by the compiler as a functional interface.
backText: False. The compiler treats any interface with exactly one abstract method as a functional interface.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.12
frontText: What is the name of the technique for delaying the creation of objects until they are needed?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.13
frontText: What is an invariant property of an object?
backText: A property that remains true regardless of how the object is modified

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.14
frontText: Name the three method prefixes used to access variables in a JavaBean.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.15
frontText: How do you modify an immutable object?
backText: You can't, although you can create a copy of the object with similar information.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.16
frontText: Write code to declare an ArrayList of Integer objects using the diamond operator.
backText: ArrayList˂Integer˃ list = new ArrayList˂˃(); or List˂Integer˃ list = new ArrayList˂˃(); or Collection˂Integer˃ list = new ArrayList˂˃();

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.17
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this class Comparable using generics: public class MyComparable ______________ { /* imagine implementation here */ }

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.18
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this code compile: public static _________ returnObject(T o) { return o;}

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.19
frontText: Does this compile? List˂Object˃ l = new ArrayList˂String˃();
backText: No. ArrayList implements List, but the generic types are not compatible.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.20
frontText: Does this compile? List˂List˃ listOfLists = new ArrayList˂? super List˃();
backText: No. A lower/upper bound may be specified on the left side of a declaration but not on the right side.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.21
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this code compile: List˂______ Number˃ listOfNumbers = new ArrayList˂Object˃();

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.22
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this code compile: List˂______ Number˃ listOfNumbers = new ArrayList˂Integer˃();

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.23
frontText: Does this code compile? List˂? extends Number˃ listOfNumbers = new ArrayList˂Number˃();
backText: Yes. For upper and lower bounds, the extends and super keywords include the class itself.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.24
frontText: Does this code compile? List˂? implements Collection˃ byInterface = new ArrayList˂Collection˃();
backText: No. Upper bounds use extends for both classes and interfaces as the upper bound.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.25
frontText: Do lower or upper bounds allow you to add elements to a list?
backText: Lower bounds do because they specify the class that all types must be above using super.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.26
frontText: What method takes a Consumer parameter and is available on both Stream and ArrayList?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.27
frontText: What functional interface takes one parameter and returns a (possibly) different Object type?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.28
frontText: What functional interface takes two parameters and returns a boolean?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.29
frontText: What functional interface takes zero parameters and returns void?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.30
frontText: What functional interface takes zero parameters and has a get() method.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.31
frontText: What functional interface takes two parameters and has an accept() method?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.32
frontText: What functional interface takes one parameter and returns void?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.33
frontText: What functional interface takes one parameter and returns the same Object type?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.34
frontText: How do you create an Optional without a value?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.35
frontText: How do you create an Optional with the value "hi"?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.36
frontText: How do you check if an Optional variable named o contains a value and return a boolean result?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.37
frontText: How do you retrieve the value of an Optional variable named o if you know for sure there is a value inside?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.38
frontText: Which of these are required in a stream pipeline: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.39
frontText: When creating a Locale with one parameter, what is it?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.40
frontText: When creating a Locale with two parameters, what are they and in what order?
backText: The language code followed by the country code

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.41
frontText: In a Locale, is the language code in uppercase or lowercase?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.42
frontText: In a Locale, is the country code in uppercase or lowercase?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.43
frontText: What is the most common format for name/value pairs in a property file?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.44
frontText: What is the most common format for a comment in a property file?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.45
frontText: If the matching resource bundle is RB_en_US.properties, what other filenames will Java look for when searching for matching keys?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.46
frontText: In what package are the new Java 8 date/time classes?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.47
frontText: Is a class that extends RuntimeException a checked or unchecked exception?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.48
frontText: True or false? A program should handle or declare java.lang.Error.
backText: False. A program must handle or declare checked exceptions. It should not handle or declare java.lang.Error.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.49
frontText: When do you use the throw and throws keywords?
backText: throw is used when throwing an exception. throws is used in a method declaration.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.50
frontText: A regular try statement (not a try‐with‐resources) is allowed to have how many finally blocks if no catch blocks are present?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.51
frontText: A regular try statement (not a try‐with‐resources) statement is allowed to have how many catch blocks if no finally block is present?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.52
frontText: If a try statement has both a catch block and a finally block, in what order do they run if an exception is thrown?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.53
frontText: If a try statement has both a catch block and a finally block, in what order do they run if an exception is not thrown?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.54
frontText: If the try block, catch block, and finally block all throw an exception, which gets thrown to the caller?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.55
frontText: What are the two differences between Runnable and Callable?
backText: Unlike Runnable, Callable returns a generic type and can throw checked exceptions.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.56
frontText: What is the difference between calling shutdown() and shutdownNow() on a thread executor?
backText: The shutdown() method prevents new tasks from being added and waits for all previously submitted tasks to finish. The shutdownNow() method does the same except that it attempts to stop all running tasks and cancels any tasks that have not been started yet.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.57
frontText: How many threads are allocated in a pool created by calling Executors.newCachedThreadPool()?
backText: Unspecified. The pool will add more threads as they are needed.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.58
frontText: True or false? A livelock is an undesirable result that occurs when two tasks are executed at the same time.
backText: False. This is the description for a race condition.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.59
frontText: Name two concurrent collection classes that are sorted.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.60
frontText: What is the name of the Concurrency API list class that creates a new array structure anytime the list is modified?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.61
frontText: What is the difference between FileOutputStream and FileWriter?
backText: FileOutputStream writes data in bytes, while FileWriter uses characters.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.62
frontText: Name two techniques for reading non‐password text input from a java.io.Console instance.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.63
frontText: True or false? InputStream is used to write data to a stream.
backText: False. It is used to read data from a stream

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.64
frontText: What is the standard way to determine if there is no more data available from an ObjectInputStream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.65
frontText: Name two java.io OutputStream/Writer stream classes that do not have corresponding InputStream/Reader classes.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.66
frontText: What may happen if you fail to properly close a stream resource that uses a file?
backText: Data could be lost if the program is abruptly terminated. A resource leak could also occur, in which the file is unable to be read/written until the program is terminated.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.67
frontText: True or false? You do not need to call flush() right before closing an OutputStream.
backText: True. The close() method will automatically call flush().

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.68
frontText: Which NIO.2 method reads all files in the directory tree?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.69
frontText: True or false? The java.io.File class is used only for files and the java.nio.file.Path interface is used only for directories.
backText: False. Both can be used on files and directories.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.70
frontText: What does NIO.2 stand for?
backText: Non‐blocking Input/Output, Version 2. Commonly referred to as the New I/O.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.71
frontText: What does it mean for a move to be atomic?
backText: The move is performed as single unit of execution that appears to the rest of the system as occurring instantaneously.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.72
frontText: True or false? The first index used in Path.getName(int) method is 0.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.73
frontText: True or false? Files.walk() and Files.find() use a breadth‐first algorithm.
backText: False. They use a depth‐first algorithm.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.74
frontText: Which NIO.2 method constructs a relative path from one Path object to another Path object?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.75
frontText: What are the four key JDBC interfaces you need to know for the exam?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.76
frontText: Where is the implementation of ResultSet defined?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.77
frontText: What are the main parts of a JDBC URL?
backText: jdbc, vendor/product name, and database‐specific string

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.78
frontText: What character is used to separate the three main parts of a JDBC URL?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.79
frontText: True or false? In a JDBC URL, the port is required.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.80
frontText: What are the name and location of the file inside a JDBC 4.0+ JAR that tells Java the name of the Driver implementation?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.81
frontText: When is Class.forName() called?
backText: In old (JDBC 3.0 and lower) code that doesn't specify a java.sql.Driver file

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.82
frontText: What exception does DriverManager.getConnection() throw in JDBC 4.0+ if the JAR is not in the classpath?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.83
frontText: When creating a Statement without using the defaults, what are the two parameters in order?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.1.84
frontText: On what class do you call a method to create a Statement?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.01
frontText: In an enum, when is the semicolon required after the values list?
backText: If there is anything in the enum besides the values, such as instance variables, constructors or methods.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.02
frontText: What access modifiers are allowed for enum constructors?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.03
frontText: True or false? An enum can have methods defined on the individual values.
backText: True. An abstract method can be defined or a concrete method can be overridden in the value‐specific body.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.04
frontText: Suppose B is an outer class and A is a member inner class within it. You have access to a B instance called b. How do you instantiate A?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.05
frontText: Suppose B is an outer class and A is a member inner class within it. Both have instance variables called c. How does a method in an instance of A refer to the c declared in B?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.06
frontText: When can a local inner class refer to a local variable from the method in which it was created?
backText: When the local variable is final or effectively final

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.07
frontText: In what way does Java support multiple inheritance?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.08
frontText: Under what situation can a class that implements two interfaces, each with a default method that has the same signature, still compile?
backText: The class must provide its own overridden implementation of the default method to be able to compile.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.09
frontText: Name at least three requirements to implement the immutable object pattern.
backText: Any of these five are correct: instance variables must be private and final, the class must block external access to mutable objects it contains, class methods may not be overridden, the class contains no setters, and the constructor sets all instance variable values.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.10
frontText: What is the name of the design pattern that is focused on creating read‐only objects in memory?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.11
frontText: True or false? A lambda expression requires parentheses on the left side of the expression only when there are two or more arguments.
backText: False. It also requires parentheses when there are zero arguments on the left side of the expression.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.12
frontText: True or false? Data types are optional in the left side of a lambda expression.
backText: True. Although once a data type has been set for one parameter, it must be provided for all parameters.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.13
frontText: True or false? A return statement is not required on the right side of a lambda expression when braces {} are used if the return type is void.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.14
frontText: A common solution to a problem that can lead to difficult‐to‐manage code is referred to as ___________.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.15
frontText: True or false? We can add an element to a List˂?˃.
backText: False. List˂Object˃ allows adding to the List. List˂?˃ does not because it could be a list of any type.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.16
frontText: Does this code compile? List legacy = new ArrayList˂String˃();
backText: Yes. It generates a compiler warning, but it doesn't give a compiler error.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.17
frontText: What is the natural sort ordering of “123”, “abc”, and “ABC”?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.18
frontText: What method do you need to implement in a Comparator, and how many parameters does it take?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.19
frontText: What method do you need to implement in a Comparable, and how many parameters does it take?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.20
frontText: Which would you implement using a lambda: Comparator or Comparable?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.21
frontText: What are the four main interfaces in the Java Collections Framework?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.22
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface requires unique elements?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.23
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface uses indexes?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.24
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface has key/value pairs?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.25
frontText: What does FIFO stand for, and what Java Collections Framework interface is it associated with?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.26
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference: () -˃ Math.random()

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.27
frontText: Which of these can exist multiple times in a stream pipeline: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.28
frontText: Which of these have a return type of Stream: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.29
frontText: Which of these are evaluated immediately after the method rather than participating in deferred execution: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.30
frontText: Name a terminal operation that always terminates on an infinite stream.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.31
frontText: Name a terminal operation that returns an Optional.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.32
frontText: Which of these are reductions? anyMatch(), collect(), count(), findAny()

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.33
frontText: Which of these are mutable reductions? anyMatch(), collect(), count(), findAny()

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.34
frontText: Which intermediate operation makes the stream smaller based on a Predicate?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.35
frontText: Which intermediate operation returns one element for every element passed into it using a Function to transform?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.36
frontText: Which intermediate operation is used for debugging a finite stream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.37
frontText: What are the names of all of the primitive streams?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.38
frontText: Which two static methods create an infinite stream of int primitives?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.39
frontText: What method do you call on an IntStream instance to convert it to a Stream˂Integer˃?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.40
frontText: What are the four key date and time classes, and what do they represent?
backText: LocalDate is just the date without time or time zone. LocalTime is just the time without date or time zone. LocalDateTime is the date and time without time zone. ZonedDateTime is the date and time with time zone.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.41
frontText: How do you create an object with the current date and time?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.42
frontText: How do you add an hour to a LocalTime object?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.43
frontText: How do you create a Period of a month and a day?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.44
frontText: How do you create a Duration of an hour and a half?
backText: Duration.ofMinutes(90); // other ways are correct as well.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.45
frontText: To what classes can you add a Duration?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.46
frontText: To what classes can you add a Period?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.47
frontText: What is the class used for formatting a date?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.48
frontText: True or false? If a try statement has catch blocks for FileNotFoundException and IOException, the catch blocks can be in either order.
backText: False. The more general catch blocks must appear below the more specific ones. Since FileNotFoundException is a subclass of IOException, it must come first in the catch block order.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.49
frontText: Which of the following exceptions are checked exceptions: IllegalFormatException, IOException, MissingResourceException, SQLException?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.50
frontText: What symbol is used to separate exception types in a multi‐catch statement?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.51
frontText: True or false? The variable in a multi‐catch block is allowed to be reassigned.
backText: False. This is allowed in a catch clause only when there is one exception type present.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.52
frontText: True or false? The order is important for exception types listed inside a multi‐catch block.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.53
frontText: A try‐with‐resources statement is allowed to have how many finally blocks if no catch blocks are present?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.54
frontText: A try‐with‐resources statement is allowed to have how many catch blocks if no finally block is present?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.55
frontText: True or false? The accumulator argument passed to a stream reduce() method should be associative and stateless.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.56
frontText: Which Concurrency API framework allows you to perform tasks recursively?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.57
frontText: True or false? A serial stream completes tasks in order, one record at a time.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.58
frontText: What's the difference between HashMap and ConcurrentHashMap?
backText: Unlike HashMap, ConcurrentHashMap will not throw a ConcurrentModificationException if multiple threads modify it at the same time or inside an iterator.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.59
frontText: What's the difference between a deadlock and a livelock?
backText: A deadlock occurs when two threads are blocked forever, whereas a livelock occurs when two threads appear to be active and working but are conceptually deadlocked forever.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.60
frontText: What is the name of the Concurrency API class used to allow multiple threads to synchronize at a common point?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.61
frontText: Which class in the Java API is most like HashMap but also supports access by multiple threads?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.62
frontText: Which java.io class should be used to write and format text data to a low‐level character stream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.63
frontText: Name two java.io low‐level stream classes used to read file data directly.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.64
frontText: Why does the Console method readPassword() return a character array instead of a String value?
backText: For security reasons. While character arrays can be explicitly overwritten in memory, String values are added to the shared memory pool, making the password available in memory long after it is used.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.65
frontText: What methods is a class that implements the Serializable interface required to override?
backText: There are no required methods. The serialVersionUID attribute is recommended but not required.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.66
frontText: Let's say you wanted to read binary data from a file in an efficient manner; which two java.io stream classes might you use?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.67
frontText: Which java.io class should be used to deserialize a stored data element back to an Object?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.68
frontText: Name two advantages of using the NIO.2 API to read files versus the java.io.File class.
backText: The NIO.2 API supports symbolic links and reading file‐system‐specific attributes, whereas java.io.File does not.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.69
frontText: True or false? Files.lines() does not load the entire file into memory.
backText: True. The file is read lazily.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.70
frontText: What is a symbolic link?
backText: A file within an operating system that serves a reference to another file or directory

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.71
frontText: Which NIO.2 method tests if two Path objects represent the same file within the file system?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.72
frontText: True or false? The java.nio.file.Path interface includes a method that returns true if a file is a directory.
backText: False. The Files factory class is used to determine if a file is a directory.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.73
frontText: What does the NIO.2 method subpath() do?
backText: It returns the relative subpath between the start and end indexes of an existing path.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.74
frontText: True or false? For absolute paths, Path.getName(0) is the root directory.
backText: False. Path.getName() does not include the root directory.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.75
frontText: What are the constants for the ResultSet types?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.76
frontText: What are the constants for the ResultSet concurrency modes?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.77
frontText: What exception is thrown if you request an unsupported ResultSet type or concurrency mode?
backText: None. The JDBC driver downgrades the request to one that is supported.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.78
frontText: What methods on Statement can run a SELECT SQL statement?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.79
frontText: What methods on Statement can run a DELETE SQL statement?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.80
frontText: What does executeQuery() return?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.81
frontText: What does executeUpdate() return?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.82
frontText: What does execute() return?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.83
frontText: On a forward‐only ResultSet, what method moves the cursor to the first row?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.2.84
frontText: What method gets the first column in a ResultSet if it is an int?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.01
frontText: What does “effectively final” mean in the context of an inner class?
backText: If the local variable were to have final added to the declaration, the code would still compile.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.02
frontText: What is the rule about what an anonymous inner class can extend/implement?
backText: An anonymous inner class must either extend a class by name or implement exactly one interface.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.03
frontText: What are the four access levels in Java?
backText: Public (all classes can access), protected (subclasses and code in the same package can access), private (only code in the same class can access), and default (only code in the same package can access)

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.04
frontText: What is the difference between overloading and overriding?
backText: Overriding requires the same method signature, and it is used when a subclass has a version of the method. Overloading requires the same method name but a different argument list.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.05
frontText: With what character does an annotation begin?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.06
frontText: Which of the following are standard annotations in core Java: @Extend, @Overload, @Override?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.07
frontText: At most how many instances of a singleton class should exist in memory?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.08
frontText: A class that does not expose its private variables demonstrates which design principle?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.09
frontText: A mammal has‐a backbone, a big‐cat is‐a mammal, and an ocelot is‐a big‐cat. What can we say about ocelots and backbones?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.10
frontText: Which class design strategy primarily makes use of the has‐a principle: class inheritance or object composition?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.11
frontText: True or false? Lazy instantiation is the process of creating an instance of an object or resource the first time it is requested.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.12
frontText: True or false? An interface can extend an interface and a class.
backText: False. An interface can only extend another interface.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.13
frontText: Name the three types of methods allowed in an interface definition.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.14
frontText: True or false? Design patterns try to solve problems that you encounter, which other developers before you have already solved.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.15
frontText: Rewrite this code using a lambda: Math::random

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.16
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference: w -˃ l.contains(w)

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.17
frontText: Rewrite this code using a lambda: l::contains

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.18
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference given that a List is passed in: x -˃ x.isEmpty()

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.19
frontText: Rewrite this code using a lambda: ArrayList::isEmpty

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.20
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference: () -˃ new

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.21
frontText: Rewrite this code using a lambda: ArrayList˂String˃::new

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.22
frontText: What two methods taking a lambda as a parameter can you call directly on an ArrayList (without using a stream)?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.23
frontText: What functional interface does forEach take?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.24
frontText: What functional interface does removeIf take?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.25
frontText: What method do you call on an OptionalInt to get the value if you know a value is contained?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.26
frontText: What are the primitive optional types?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.27
frontText: What is the only primitive functional interface that doesn't involve double, int, or long?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.28
frontText: Which Collector creates a single String from a Stream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.29
frontText: Which Collector returns both the average and sum in a single call to an IntStream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.30
frontText: Which Collector turns a Stream into an ArrayList?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.31
frontText: Which Collector creates a Map with the keys true and false?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.32
frontText: Which Collector creates a Map with many keys?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.33
frontText: To which method do you pass a Collector?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.34
frontText: Which class defines common Collector implementations?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.35
frontText: On an infinite stream containing nothing but the number 4, which methods will terminate when passed a Predicate that checks whether the element is 1?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.36
frontText: On an infinite stream containing nothing but the number 4, which methods will terminate when passed a Predicate that checks whether the element is 4?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.37
frontText: What class is used for formatting a percentage?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.38
frontText: Which of these times is earlier and by how much? 2016-03-14T05:00-04:00 and 2016-03-14T09:00+01:00
backText: The first is 9:00 GMT and the second is 8:00 GMT, making the second one hour earlier.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.39
frontText: Which of these times is earlier and by how much? 2016-03-14T07:00-05:00 and 2016-03-14T08:00+06:00
backText: The first is 12:00 GMT and the second is 2:00 GMT (using a 24‐hour clock), making the first two hours earlier.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.40
frontText: What happens to the clocks in the March clock change of daylight savings time?
backText: At 1:59 a.m., the time jumps to 3:00 a.m.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.41
frontText: What happens to the clocks in the November clock change of daylight savings time?
backText: At 1:59 a.m., the time jumps back to 1:00 a.m.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.42
frontText: What does this display? System.out.println(Period.of(1, 0, 3));

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.43
frontText: What does this display? System.out.println(Period.ofWeeks(1));

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.44
frontText: What does this display? System.out.println(Duration.ofMinutes(5));

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.45
frontText: What does this display? System.out.println(Duration.ofMills(123));

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.46
frontText: What interface must a class implement to be listed in the declaration of a try‐with‐resources statement?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.47
frontText: What does idempotent mean?
backText: The method is safe to run multiple times.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.48
frontText: In a try‐with‐resources statement, what is the second exception called if both the try clause and a close() method throw an exception?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.49
frontText: Which of the classes is closed first in try (C c = new C(); D d = new D()) {}?
backText: D (The last to be created is the first to be closed.)

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.50
frontText: True or false? The following statement guarantees an AssertionError is thrown: assert false;
backText: False. An AssertionError will not be thrown if assertions are not enabled at runtime.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.51
frontText: The two command‐line flags for enabling assertions are __________ and ____.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.52
frontText: What parameter is optional in an assertion?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.53
frontText: What type does the mandatory parameter in an assertion return?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.54
frontText: True or false? Synchronizing on a class object will synchronize on all instances of the class.
backText: False. The class object and the instances of the class are not related in terms of synchronization.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.55
frontText: What does it mean for a task to be atomic?
backText: An atomic task is completed as a single unit of execution without any interference by another thread.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.56
frontText: What method do you call to create a parallel stream from an existing stream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.57
frontText: True or false? All Java programs running in a JVM are multi‐threaded.
backText: True. The JVM includes daemon worker threads, such as the garbage collector.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.58
frontText: Which class that implements the ForkJoinTask interface is best to use if you do not need the return value for each task?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.59
frontText: True or false? The synchronized keyword can only be applied to non‐static methods and on blocks of code.
backText: False. It may also be applied to static methods.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.60
frontText: Name a concurrent deque class that supports blocking.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.61
frontText: True or false? The findAny() method always returns the first result in the stream.
backText: False. On serial streams it returns the first element, but on parallel streams it can return any element of the stream.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.62
frontText: On which type of stream, serial or parallel, is it appropriate to use the groupingByConcurrent() collector?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.63
frontText: True or false? The java.io.File class can be used to delete non‐empty directories.
backText: False. The java.io.File class can delete only files and empty directories.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.64
frontText: Name the two java.io stream classes used to improve performance when writing data to sequential disk‐based systems.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.65
frontText: What syntax structure can you use to avoid needing to explicitly close a java.io stream?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.66
frontText: True or false? Calling getParent() on a root directory returns null.
backText: True. The root directory has no parent.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.67
frontText: True or false? Calling flush() closes an OutputStream.
backText: False. The flush() method may be called repeatedly while the stream is open.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.68
frontText: The _________ path is the full path from the root to the file or directory.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.69
frontText: Name two methods for writing to a java.io.Console instance.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.70
frontText: True or false? Files.list() traverses a directory tree.
backText: False. Files.list() reads only a single directory, not the tree.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.71
frontText: What does Path.toAbsolutePath() return on a relative path?
backText: The existing path of the current directory as a prefix

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.72
frontText: How do you delete a directory in NIO.2?
backText: First, delete all of the contents of the directory; then call Files.delete() on it.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.73
frontText: What happens to a Path supplied to a compatible NIO.2 method that includes the NOFOLLOW_LINKS option?
backText: If the Path is a symbolic link, the operation will be performed on the link itself, rather than the target of the symbolic link.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.74
frontText: What's the difference between Files.createDirectory() and Files.createDirectories()?
backText: Files.createDirectory()creates only a single path, whereas Files.createDirectories() creates all subdirectories along the input path that do not exist.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.75
frontText: Which NIO.2 method reads the entire contents of file to memory when it is first called?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.76
frontText: What method gets a date and time from a ResultSet for column 5?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.77
frontText: True or false? Calling rs.getString(1) before calling rs.next() throws a SQLException on a forward‐only ResultSet.

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.78
frontText: On a scrollable ResultSet, how do you move the cursor to the third row?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.79
frontText: On a scrollable ResultSet, how do you move the cursor to the last row?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.80
frontText: On a scrollable ResultSet, how do you move the cursor to the row immediately before the current one?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.81
frontText: On a scrollable ResultSet, how do you move the cursor to the row immediately after the last one?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.82
frontText: In what order should the three JDBC resources be closed?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.83
frontText: When closing a ResultSet, what other resources get closed?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.84
frontText: When closing a Statement, what other resources get closed?

title: fc067900.JaSE8PrgIISG.3.85
frontText: When closing a Connection, what other resources get closed?
